title: Ryze Comic, Ryze & Brand Short Story and update for Ryze and Brand
body:
Comic: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/comic/ryze/ryze-comic
From the Ashes: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/from-the-ashes
Ryze Bio: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/ryze/
Brand Bio: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/brand/

replies.body:
Was the bio of Ryze even changed?

Looks the same to me.

Yes. Small changes: 

> The master is now from Helia (Blessed Isles)
> No mention to Icathia
> Changed birthplace

Ah thank you.

And makes sense that they changed the bit about icathia,otherwise it'd mean that it was annihilated twice(once by Tyrus,once by the void)
Also the fight between Tyrus and Ryze was cut, with Tyrus being immediately killed and Ryze transformation by the Rune was also removed for a reason...

Ryze was never transformed by the Runes. That's what makes him different from Tyrus, and able to continue the mission for centuries afterwards.

(With varied results!)
Then how did he get that sexy blue colour? :P
Transformed by centuries of general magic use.
This. He's hella old. :-)

I don't know if I'm asking the right person, but would it be possible to have an official timeline of the world of League of Legends on the Universe site?
I know there have been discussions about it here on the boards, but sometimes it's hard to remember the chronological order of certain events and it would be much better for us if we could access the information as easily as we can navigate the new map.
I'd love that! One step at a time, though... you should see how many grey hairs resulted from the creation of the map, across Riot...! :-D

if it makes you feel any better, i'm working on a comprehensive timeline for all of League. It won't have dates, but it'll be in chronological order from literally the creation of this world up to the most recently established event happening
Is that the official reason for his skin?
Nothing is official unless Riot publishes it in a product. But that's my explanation for it - you can choose whether to place faith in that, I guess! :-)
always had it i guess?

The whole thing was re-drafted for brevity, and clarity. If you were to compare them side by side, you'd see virtually every sentence was changed in some way.

And yet we didn't really CHANGE anything about him, as a character. Who'd have thought it possible?! :-P
His related champion list is the same as well, does this mean it's still Canon or you guys didn't consider changes in that yet? *yes thinking about Sona as usual*
I never thought I'd say this, but I feel bad for ~~Brand~~ Kegan. That was one of the most tragic stories I've read from Riot.

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=tkt7t6to,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-07-25T17:33:11.891+0000)
>
> I never thought I'd say this, but I feel bad for ~~Brand~~ Kegan. That was one of the most tragic stories I've read from Riot.

Yeah, especially considering the circumstances of his birth.

Coudn't  Brand just be empowered by a world Rune? Was there a need to make him inferior to Ryze out of nowhere? From a power of destruction, he gets turned into an angsty teen equivalent. Hes power is also no longer his own, but is instead a past mistake of Ryze, who has to make things right. It feels like a step in the wrong direction.

Was it stated somewhere that Lux has the fortitude to resist a World Rune?

If Lux tried to use a World Rune, even if she could resist it, it would immediately be unable to become Ryze's apprendice, as this one doesn't want anyone using them
Ryze said in the end of the comic that before he finds another apprentice, no matter how talented he may be, he must first destroy Brand so his past failure doesn't haunt him forever
Not saying he'd take her on as an apprentice; just that I wonder what he'd think of her. Too chipper?
Morlocks in Runeterra confirmed.
